definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

sentences.english: The orchestra will give two more performances before leaving Britain.
sentences.chinese: 離開英國之前，這個管絃樂隊將加演兩場。

sentences.english: By popular demand, the play will run for another week.
sentences.chinese: 應廣大觀衆要求，這齣戲將加演一週。

sentences.english: There'll be a further performance of the play next week.
sentences.chinese: 這齣戲下星期將加演一場。

sentences.english: No more encore except for the afterglow.
sentences.chinese: 再無需加演，因爲有餘輝。

sentences.english: The performance was so good that the applause didn't die down until there was an encore.
sentences.chinese: 該表演非常精彩，鼓掌聲一直到加演才平息下來。

sentences.english: The orchestra will give two more performances this week.
sentences.chinese: 這個管絃樂隊本週將加演兩場。

sentences.english: We go offstage and come back for the convention of the encore.
sentences.chinese: 按照加演的傳統做法，我們走到後臺後又再次返場。

definition: to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
(of a play, movie etc) to begin
maiden stage role/first performance/first public showing
to perform (e.g. on the stage)/to lecture
(theater etc) to tour/to be on tour/to give itinerant performances/abbr. for 巡迴演出|巡回演出[xun2 hui2 yan3 chu1]
(theater etc) to tour/to be on tour/to give itinerant performances
